articles.title: Views Exchanged between First-Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs of DPRK and Chinese Envoy
articles.content:
Views Exchanged between First-Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs of DPRK and Chinese Envoy
Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Views were exchanged between Kang Sok Ju, first-vice minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and State Councillor of the People's Republic of China Dai Bingguo who is special envoy of Hu Jintao, President of the PRC, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and from the Chinese side the special envoy's party and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Both sides had a candid and in-depth exchange of views on the issue of developing the friendly relations between the DPRK and the PRC and regional and international matters in a comradely atmosphere.

articles.title: Chinese Envoy Here
articles.content:
Chinese Envoy Here
Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- State Councillor of the People's Republic of China Dai Bingguo who is special envoy of Hu Jintao, President of the PRC, arrived here Wednesday by plane.
					 Arriving together with him were Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Fu Ziying, vice-minister of Commerce, Qiu Yuanping, vice-director of the Central Foreign Affairs Office, and Guo Yezhou, assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 The special envoy and his party were greeted by Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Government Hosts Reception in Honor of Chinese Envoy
articles.content:
DPRK Government Hosts Reception in Honor of Chinese Envoy
Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government hosted a reception in honor of the special envoy of Hu Jintao, President of the People's Republic of China, on a visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Present there on invitation were special envoy Dai Bingguo, state councillor of the People's Republic of China, and his party and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Chinese Envoy Watches Extravaganza "Arirang"
articles.content:
Chinese Envoy Watches Extravaganza "Arirang"
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- State Councillor of the People's Republic of China Dai Bingguo who is special envoy of Hu Jintao, President of the PRC, and his party on a visit to the DPRK watched the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" at the May Day Stadium Wednesday.
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, working people in Pyongyang and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Talks between WPK and LPRP Delegations Held
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and LPRP Delegations Held
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party were held here on Wednesday. 
					 Present at the talks from the WPK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of its Central Committee, Ri Tuk Nam, vice-chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK, and officials concerned and from the LPRP side were members of the delegation of the LPRP headed by Asang Laoly, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of its Central Committee and chairman of the Control Commission of its Central Committee who doubles as vice-prime minister and president of the State Inspection Commission of Laos, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, ambassador of Laos to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and discussed the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and exchanged views on matters of mutual concern. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Delegation of LPRP Feted
articles.content:
Delegation of LPRP Feted
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea gave a reception at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday in honor of the delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were the delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party headed by Asang Laoly, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the LPRP and chairman of the Control Commission of its Central Committee who is vice-prime minister and president of the State Inspection Commission of Laos, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, ambassador of Laos to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, Ri Tuk Nam, vice-chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK and officials concerned.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok noted in his speech that the WPK and people are pleased with the fact that the Lao people have achieved a lot of successes in their efforts to implement the decisions of the 8th party congress under the leadership of the LPRP headed by Choummaly Saynasone. 
					
					 He stressed that it is the common desire of the two peoples to boost the friendly relations between the two parties and two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and Kaysone Phomvihane.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two parties and two countries would grow stronger thanks to their concerted efforts.
					
					 Asang Laoly said in his speech that the DPRK has made eye-opening progress thanks to the correct line and policies of the WPK which has held Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem.
					
					 He referred to the Korean people's energetic endeavors to open the gate to a thriving socialist nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He emphasized the Lao party, government and people wish the party, government and people of the DPRK greater successes.

articles.title: Delegation of LPRP Watches Extravaganza "Arirang"
articles.content:
Delegation of LPRP Watches Extravaganza "Arirang"
 Pyongyang, September 16 -- The delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party headed by Asang Laoly, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the LPRP and chairman of the Control Commission of its Central Committee who is vice-prime minister and president of the State Inspection Commission of Laos, on a visit to the DPRK, watched the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" at the May Day Stadium Wednesday.
					Among the audience were Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, working people in Pyongyang, Chaleune Warinthrasak, Lao ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: Wreaths Sent to Cuban Embassy by C.C., WPK and Presidium of SPA
articles.content:
Wreaths Sent to Cuban Embassy by Presidium of SPA and International Affairs Department of C.C., WPK
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the International Affairs Department of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent wreaths to the Cuban embassy here on Wednesday to mourn the death of Major of the Revolution Juan Almeida Bosque, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba.
					 Wreaths were also sent there by the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Foreign Trade, the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba.
					
					 Those were placed before a portrait of the deceased. 
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Minister of Education Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 After laying wreaths, the participants paid silent tribute to him and made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Talks between Hydro-meteorological Administrations of DPRK and China Held
articles.content:
Talks between Hydro-meteorological Administrations of DPRK and China Held
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The 15th round of the talks on the exchange and cooperation in meteorological science and technology between the State Hydro-meteorological Administration of the DPRK and the Bureau of Meteorology of China was held in Beijing on Tuesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the delegation of the administration led by its Director Ko Il Hun and from the Chinese side were the members of the delegation of the bureau led by its director.
					
					 Earlier, talks on cooperation in hydrologic service in the Amnok and Tuman rivers were held in Beijing between the delegations of the State Hydro-meteorological Administration of the DPRK led by Ko Il Hun and the Ministry of Water Resources of China led by its vice-minister.
					
					 A ceremony of conveying the hydrological measuring equipment donated by the Chinese ministry to the administration of the DPRK was held on the occasion of the "year of DPRK-China friendship."

articles.title: Greetings to Mexican President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mexican President
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Felipe Calderon Hinojosa, President of Mexico, on the occasion of the 199th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the DPRK and Mexico would continue to grow stronger, wishing the president success in his work for well-being of the people and social progress.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 61st birthday of the DPRK headed by Pae Ik Ju, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Outgoing Pakistani Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Outgoing Pakistani Ambassador
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Noorullah Khan, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell visit to him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Chorus
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Chorus
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M.E. Pyatnichki on a visit to the DPRK.
					 It was conveyed to an official concerned by Aleksandra Permyakova, its head and manager.

articles.title: Chinese Wushu Demonstration Performances Given
articles.content:
Chinese Wushu Demonstration Performances Given
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Demonstration performances were given at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Tuesday and Wednesday by the Wushu demonstration group of China on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of the "year of the DPRK-China friendship".
					 Among the spectators were Hwang Pong Yong, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who doubles as president of the Korean Martial Art Federation, officials concerned, working people and youth and students in the city.
					
					 Speeches were made before the start of the presentations.

articles.title: First-Phase Construction of University of Science and Technology Completed
articles.content:
First-Phase Construction of University of Science and Technology Completed
Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for the completion of the first-phase construction of Pyongyang University of Science and Technology was held Wednesday.
					 Present there were Jon Kuk Man, vice-minister of Education, officials concerned and members of a delegation led by Chin Kyung Kim, founding-president of the university.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 After a certificate on nominating the co-managerial president of the university was conveyed to the founding-president, the participants looked round the building of the university completed as the first-phase construction.

articles.title: State Academic Degrees and Titles Conferred upon Intellectuals of Merits
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees and Titles Conferred upon Intellectuals of Merits
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were awarded to the intellectuals in recognition of their great contributions to scientific researches and the education of the younger generation. 
					 The title of an academician went to Rim Chun Hak, director of the Ophthalmic Hospital of the Korea General Red-Cross Hospital, and the title of a candidate academician to Ri Sung Bin, teacher at
						 Kim Il Sung University, and Ri Kun Son, researcher at the State Academy of Sciences. 
					
					 The title of professor was conferred upon Kim Myong Chol, teacher at Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry, and Choe Kwang Ryol, head of a department of Korea University of Physical Education, while the doctorate went to Ra Mun Yok, room chief of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Ki Jun, head of a department of Kim Chaek University of Technology, and others. The title of an associate professor was awarded to 35 persons.  
					
					 A ceremony of awarding the academic degrees and titles was held on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Sheetlet Issued
articles.content:
New Sheetlet Issued
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A new sheetlet has been published in the DPRK on the occasion of the death anniversary (Sep. 22, 1949) of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 The words "Eternal Bodyguard", "Juche 38 (1949)" and "Juche 98 (2009)" are printed on the sheetlet, which includes stamps showing the immortal images of her who protected the safety of President Kim Il Sung and devoted herself to realizing his cause of founding the army with azalea flowers in full bloom in the background.

articles.title: Life-long Creed of Great Revolutionary
articles.content:
Life-long Creed of Great Revolutionary
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, regarded it as the sacred duty assigned by history and people and life-long creed to support and defend the revolutionary idea and line of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Having firmly believed that the revolution would emerge victorious only when they trusted in and followed the President from the first days when she started revolutionary activities in her early years, she remained faithful to his idea and line throughout her life.
					
					 Om, a renegade to the revolution, slandered the revolutionary idea and line of the President at the Qingfeng Secret Camp in a year of the second half of the 1930s during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. Then          Kim Jong Suk resolutely fought with him, saying to the following effect: We are soldiers of General Kim Il Sung. Who are you? You are an enemy of the revolution.
					
					 Later at a meeting exposing and condemning Om's crimes, she emphasized: Let us defend the revolutionary idea of Comrade Commander with our lives! This is our loftiest and honorable duty.
					
					 Under the complicated situation after the liberation of the country, too, she thoroughly defended the revolutionary idea and line of the President as she did in the days of the anti-Japanese war.
					
					 In the early period for national building, she told anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters that they should frustrate the moves of the renegades to the revolution and factionalists and thoroughly implement the President's line on building a party, state and army as they did during fighting in mountains in the past, personally showing a living example for them.
					
					 Upon hearing the news that a lecture for masses on the establishment of the people's government which was held at the auditorium of Pyongyang Girls' Secondary School No. 4 (at that time) on a February day of Juche 35 (1946) was called off by moves of reactionaries, she lost no time to go there and gave a lecture.
					
					 Her reasonable and enthusiastic lecture touched heartstrings of the audience so strongly that they chanted "Long live General Kim Il Sung!", "Let's become nation-building fighters consolidating a democratic foundation, upholding the line of General Kim Il Sung!" and other slogans.
					
					 Indeed, she was a great revolutionary who was possessed of the revolutionary outlook on the leader and the spirit of defending the leader with her life on the highest phase.
					
					Today the spirit of guarding the revolutionary headquarters at the risk of lives shown by
						 Kim Jong Suk is being thoroughly carried forward as a valuable tradition of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The Korean people will defend socialism firmly and build a great, prosperous and powerful nation, holding aloft the Songun idea and leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminar and Reading Sessions on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
articles.content:
Seminar and Reading Sessions on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A seminar and reading sessions on General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" took place in Mexico, Democratic Congo and at the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement on Sept. 4 and 5.
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, said at the seminar that the work is one of historical significance that proved the invincibility of the DPRK, expressing firm belief that the Korean people would certainly open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012.
					
					Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that
						  Kim Jong Il has directed all efforts to the work for the prosperity of the country under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea, the Songun idea in order to glorify the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in the nation-building by founding the DPRK and leading it along the road of prosperity.
					
					 Nzemba Yangana, chairman of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo, at a reading session called on the adherents to the Juche idea not only to earnestly study the Songun idea but raise voices supporting the Korean people's just cause.
					
					 Othieno Stephen, executive secretary of the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement, noted at a reading session that the more than six decade-long history of the DPRK is a history of shining struggles and victory and a history of creation and changes in which the Korean people built a rich and powerful and prosperous socialist country, defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country, under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and the great Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Kuwait
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Kuwait
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Kuwait preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association jointly released a special bulletin on Sept. 7 on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the founding of the DPRK. 
					 The bulletin in an article recalled that the DPRK has dynamically advanced along the road of socialism over the past more than six decades and has stood an invulnerable fortress of socialism, drawing the attention of the international community. 
					
					 Noting that since its foundation, the DPRK has energetically pushed forward the cause of socialism, guided by the Juche idea, the Songun idea fathered by the President, the founding-father of the DPRK, the bulletin stressed that the Juche idea in the DPRK has served as the basic line and main principle for the building of the socialist state and its activities and the Songun idea provided a sure guarantee for the victory of the cause of socialism. 
					
					 The DPRK has tremendous national power, the bulletin said, and continued:
					
					 Socialist Korea is a publicly recognized political and ideological power. 
					
					 The DPRK has achieved the unity and cohesion of all the people in thinking and purpose based on the Songun idea. 
					
					 The Korean People's Army has demonstrated its might as an invincible army which no army of any country can match in idea and faith. 
					
					 Giving a detailed account of the fact that the government of the DPRK is absolutely trusted and supported by the people, the bulletin noted that the Korean people are bringing about fresh innovations and performing exploits day by day in the drive to open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012, true to the plan and intention of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in India, Democratic Congo, Guinea and Indonesia from Sept. 3 to 5 on the occasion of the 61st birthday of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books introducing the DPRK.
					
					Shrendra Singh, secretary general of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung, said that the DPRK has grown strong to be an invulnerable bulwark of socialism thanks to its outstanding guiding idea, tremendous national power and rock-firm mass foundation, adding that the DPRK will always demonstrate its might as an invincible fortress of socialism. 
					
					 Kanga Ngerien Jerom, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, said that the DPRK has become a political and ideological power and a military power. He also noted that the government of the DPRK is absolutely trusted and supported by the popular masses for representing their independent rights, organizing their creative ingenuity and activities and being responsible for their livelihood. 
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chief of the Guinean Group for the Study of February 16 Art, pointed out that
						 Kim Jong Il has performed great exploits for the country and people with his extraordinary ideological and theoretical wisdom and outstanding leadership art for a long period of leading the Korean revolution.
					
					 The deputy director general of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Company of Indonesia stressed that it is entirely thanks to the invincible Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il that the DPRK has won one victory after another despite the persistent moves of the imperialist reactionary forces including the U.S. to suffocate the DPRK.

articles.title: Honest Solution of Issue of "Comfort Women" Demanded
articles.content:
Honest Solution of Issue of "Comfort Women" Demanded
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Ikoma City Assembly of Nara Prefecture in Japan adopted a resolution on Sept. 11 demanding the government solve the issue of the "comfort women" for imperial Japanese army.
					 The resolution recalled that much water has flown under the bridge since Japan's neighboring countries suffered a lot from its colonial rule in the past but their wounds have not yet been healed but they will continue to suffer in the generations to come. 
					
					 It stressed that Japan's sincere approach towards the above-said issue amounts to showing before the international community the will of the Japanese government to take measures against the recurrence of abuses of women's rights. 
					
					 It urged the government to probe the truth behind the issue and give proper education to the younger generation.

articles.title: Love for Revolutionary Comrades
articles.content:
Love for Revolutionary Comrades
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- One day of October, Juche 29 (1940) anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk made padded clothes all night for the members of a small group of the guerrilla army with which communications had been severed.
					 After completing the work, she felt that something was short and continued to make various souvenirs for them.
					
					 Later President Kim Il Sung saw the padded clothes and souvenirs and appreciated her, saying that she did a good thing and that those who were undergoing difficulties in the enemy rear would be very happy to put on the clothes.
					
					 Prior to leaving the place a few days after, the President instructed his members to bury provisions and the padded clothes so that the small group could find out them.
					
					 So Kim Jong Suk dug the bonfire site and piled up the supplies in the hole and stuffed it with dry branches and fallen-leaves to prevent them from moisture.
					
					 The members of the small group found out the winter uniforms along with provisions and souvenirs including tobacco pouches and bags for notebooks to be moved deeply by her love.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y del PPRL
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y del PPRL
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 16 en esta capital en el ambiente camaraderil y amistoso las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao.
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana el secretario del CC del PTC, Choe Thae Bok, el vicepresidente de la Comision del Control del CC del partido, Ri Tuk Nam, y otros funcionarios y por la laosiana los miembros de la delegacion presidida por el miembro del Buro Politico, secretario y presidente de la Comision del Control, del CC del PPRL, Asang Laoly, quien es el viceprimer ministro del gobierno y presidente del Comite de Control del Estado y el embajador lao en Corea, Chaleune Warinthrasak.
					
					 En las conversaciones ambas partes se informaron del estado de actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos partidos y los problemas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: APS y PTC envian ofrendas florales a embajada cubana
articles.content:
APS y PTC envian ofrendas florales a embajada cubana
 Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema (APS) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Departamento Internacional del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea (PTC) enviaron el dia 16 las ofrendas florales a la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea en memoria del Comandante de la Revolucion Juan Almeida Bosque, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de Cuba y vicepresidente del Consejo de Estado de la RC.
					 Lo hicieron tambien el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Ministerio de Comercio Exterior, el Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero (CRCE) y el Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba (CCSC).
					
					 Las ofrendas florales fueron colocadas ante la foto del difunto.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Yang Hyong Sop, el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Educacion y presidente interino del CCSC Kim Yong Jin, el presidente interino del CRCE, Mun Jae Chol, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Thae Jong, el viceministro de las FAP, Pak Jae Gyong, y el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun.
					
					  Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio tras depositarlas y dejaron inscripciones en el libro de condolencias.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre los organos hidrometeorologicos de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre los organos hidrometeorologicos de Corea y China
 Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en Beijing la XV ronda de las conversaciones sobre el intercambio y la cooperacion de las ciencias y tecnicas meteorologicas entre la Direccion Meteorologica e Hidrologica de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea  y el Buro Estatal de Meteorologia de la Republica Popular China.
					 En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion de la citada Direccion dirigida por el director Ko Il Hun y, por la china, los miembros de la delegacion de dicho Buro Estatal encabezado por su director.
					
					 Con anterioridad, se realizaron en la misma ciudad las conversaciones sobre la cooperacion del trabajo hidraulico en los rios Amnok y Tuman entre la citada delegacion coreana y la delegacion del Ministerio de Recursos Hidraulicos de China presidida por el viceministro.
					
					 Por otra parte, se efectuo la ceremonia de que con motivo del "Ano de Amistad Corea-China" el ministerio chino arriba mencionado dona las instalaciones de observacion hidraulica a la Direccion Meteorologica e Hidrologica de Corea.

articles.title: Otorgados titulos y cargos cientificos a intelectuales destacados
articles.content:
Otorgados titulos y cargos cientificos a intelectuales destacados
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ATCC) -- A los intelectuales quienes hicieron gran contribucion a la  investigacion cientifica y la labor docente de las generaciones venideras fueron otorgados los titulos y cargos cientificos.
					 El director del Hospital de Oftalmologia del Hospital Universal de la Cruz Roja de Corea, Rim Chun Hak, fue condecorado con el titulo de academico y el profesor de la Universidad           Kim Il Sung, Ri Sung Bin, y el investigador de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, Ri Kun Son, con los titulos de candidato al academico.
					
					 Ademas, al profesor de la Universidad de Industria Ligera Han Tok Su de Pyongyang, Kim Myong Chol, al jefe de catedra de la Universidad de Cultura Fisica de Corea, Choe Kwang Ryol y otros fue  otorgada la categoria docente del profesor titular, al jefe de seccion de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Ra Mun Yok, y al jefe de catedra de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, Kim Ki Jun, etc., el doctorado y a otras 35 personas, la categoria docente del candidato al profesor titular.
					
					 La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar el dia 16.
